编译器每日情报 2025-08-18

导航： GCC LLVM Swift Rust Zig Cranelift/Wasmtime V8 GraalVM

GCC

[GCC 15] aarch64: Fix mode mismatch when building a predicate [PR121118]

medium

The fix addresses a mode mismatch issue in aarch64's SVE instruction set where the combination of two predicates using `aarch64_expand_sve_const_pred_trn` required inputs with VNx16BI mode, but one input was producing VNx8BI due to usage of `aarch64_sve_move_pred_via_while`. The patch opts for a simpler approach of casting the output to VNx16BI post-facto rather than making invasive target-independent changes.

  • Mode mismatch issue in aarch64 SVE instruction set
  • Casting output to VNx16BI instead of making invasive changes
GCCaarch64SVEmode mismatchpredicateIR/PassReleaseToolchainBackend/Targetmedium

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/VI1PR08MB5325CFEB1A38EF036F519632FF31A@VI1PR08MB5325.eurprd08.prod.outlook.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/mptect8rkg2.fsf@arm.com/

[GCC 15] aarch64: Fix mode mismatch when building a predicate [PR121118]

medium

The fix addresses a mode mismatch issue in aarch64's SVE instruction set where the combination of two predicates using `aarch64_expand_sve_const_pred_trn` required inputs with VNx16BI mode, but one input was producing VNx8BI due to usage of `aarch64_sve_move_pred_via_while`. PR81358: Enable automatic linking of libatomic

medium

Discussion on enabling automatic linking of libatomic in GCC, noting issues with `ifunc` recognition during builds for arm-none-linux-gnueabihf and x86_64 architectures.

  • PR81358 aims to enable automatic linking of libatomic
  • `ifunc` availability issue detected in arm-none-linux-gnueabihf and x86_64 builds

Fix handling of partial clobbers in GCC

medium

This change addresses the issue related to how GCC handles partial register clobbering by refining the logic for identifying which registers a function call is allowed to alter partially.

  • Introduces a method to distinguish between full and partial register alterations
  • Enhances conservative assumptions for computing reaching definitions and availability
GCCcompiler optimizationpartial clobbersregister handlinghighBackend/Target

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/4a56ba8c8ec281ef794a598f64a5707204ca9088

[PATCH] gcse: Fix handling of partial clobbers [PR97497]

medium

The patch addresses an internal inconsistency in the gcse pass of GCC regarding how it handles partial register clobbers. The fix ensures that both liveness and transparency computations are consistent by treating partial clobbers as full clobbers where necessary.

  • Fixes inconsistency in handling partial clobbers in gcse
  • Ensures consistency between liveness and transparency calculations
  • Includes new member functions for predefined_function_abi::only_partial_reg_clobbers
GCCgcsepartial clobbersregister allocationIR/PassToolchainBackend/Targethigh

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/mpttt25qahd.fsf@arm.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/mptldnhq6sj.fsf@arm.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAFiYyc2rFueLcLCYthwijz7Oro7Fo8NSAG=cH-RueGkN5f5bjQ@mail.gmail.com/

libstdc++: Add nodiscard attribute for ranges algorithm [PR121476]

low

This patch adds the [[nodiscard]] attribute to the operator() of ranges algorithm function objects if their std counterpart has it. Additionally, certain algorithms lacking a std counterpart now have this attribute added.

  • Adds [[nodiscard]] attribute to operator() for ranges algorithms
  • Includes find_last*, contains, contains_subrange functions
  • Updates min/max overloads with std::initializer_list
libstdc++patchnodiscardrangesIR/PassReleaseToolchainlowmediumGCC

Compiler Issues and Improvements

medium

The materials highlight two compiler-related changes: one in Clang addressing a lambda return type deduction issue, and another in GCC for LoongArch to implement atomic load using LSX.

  • Clang fixed an issue where the return type of discarded lambdas was not correctly deduced
  • GCC added support for 16-byte atomic load with LSX on LoongArch

medium

  • Adds 'defer' keyword functionality via -fdefer-ts flag
  • Includes documentation and test cases for defer statement
  • Waiting for feedback before sending v3 with adjustments

libstdc++: Fix self element self-assigments when inserting an empty range

low

A fix was committed to the libstdc++ library to prevent self-move assignments when inserting an empty range into a vector. The change adds a check for an empty size, preventing unnecessary move operations. A new test case was also added.

  • Fixes self element self-assigments when inserting an empty range
  • Modifies include/bits/vector.tcc and testsuite/23_containers/vector/modifiers/insert/insert_range.cc files
  • Includes a new test case
libstdc++vectorinsertionbugfixGCClow

[PATCH v2] [x86] Enable unroll in the vectorizer

medium

The patch enables unrolling in the vectorizer for specific operations like FMA/DOT_PROD_EXPR/SAD_EXPR on x86 architecture. It introduces a new member to processor_cost, reduc_lat_mult_thr, calculated as latency times throughput.

  • Enable unroll when there's reduction for specific expressions
  • Add support for SAD_EXPR and update relevant checks
  • Introduce reduc_lat_mult_thr: latency * throughput
  • Final unrolling factor is MIN(vect_unroll_limit, calculated value)
performancevectorizationunrollIR/PassPerformanceBackend/TargetmediumGCC

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAMZc-bxq443uZsVgbVusMUryRjUiUCi6UQ+xQd7OP8kvwH3bqw@mail.gmail.com/

[RFC PATCH v2] [AutoFDO] Source filename tracking in GCOV

medium

This patch updates GCC to track and compare source filenames from the GCOV file with DECL_SOURCE_FILE for symbols, enabling efficient annotation of profile counts even when symbol names clash.

  • Patch reads file names from GCOV and compares them against DECL_SOURCE_FILE
  • Tracks clashing symbol names more efficiently by stripping suffixes during reading
  • Autoprofilebootstrapped and regtested on aarch64-linux-gnu
GCCAutoFDOGCOVProfile CountingSource File TrackinglowToolchainBackend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250818082546.33686-1-dhruvc@nvidia.com/https://gcc.gnu.org/pipermail/gcc-patches/2025-June/686835.html

[PATCH v2] x86: Place the TLS call before all register setting BBs

medium

This patch addresses an issue where TLS calls were improperly placed, potentially clobbering flags registers and affecting live caller-saved registers. It introduces changes to ensure that such calls are correctly positioned before specific basic blocks.

  • TLS calls must not precede conditional jumps or within blocks with live caller-saved registers
  • New function `ix86_get_dominator_for_reg` introduced
  • Updates to handle replaced GNU and GNU2 TLS instructions
x86TLSGCCAssembly OptimizationlowBackend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250817205005.678470-1-hjl.tools@gmail.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAMZc-bxDhZ8G9=m3gvDqHugUWpaducpOF9d_Zw5q1=3+Ywhbfg@mail.gmail.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAMZc-bwy_QAxvs6wrAXmoO7kvEGBs3L8ONjYkYrcqBruMgrHBg@mail.gmail.com/

LoongArch: Clean up atomic operations and implement 16-byte atomic operations

high

Lulu Cheng pushed patches related to cleaning up atomic operations on LoongArch, implementing 16-byte CAS with sc.q. However, a bug was identified where the implementation fails to correctly read original values into registers if expected != original. This leads to potential page exceptions in read-only memory.

  • Patches pushed for LoongArch atomic operation cleanup and 16-byte CAS
  • Bug found: incorrect handling of expected vs. original value
  • Potential page exception issue in read-only memory
LoongArchatomic operationsbug fixmemory accessGCClow

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/c1a65e19519c6782d1bd476f8c644bb2211d89a4.camel@xry111.site/

csky: Use Quotes When Referring to cpus and archs

low

The thread discusses the usage of quotes when referring to CPU and architecture names in the csky port of GCC, which is still being built daily for glibc. The discussion also touches on whether it makes sense to consider removing this dead or less-used port.

  • Patch PR90160 updates csky configuration to use %qs for cpu and arch names
  • Port is still used for building glibc but has seen limited recent activity
  • Discussion around potential removal of the csky port

Implementing 'defer' Keyword in GCC

medium

The patch series implements the 'defer' keyword based on technical specification n3589, controlled by a new command-line flag '-fdefer-ts'. The implementation uses existing mechanisms for cleanup attributes and statement expressions. It includes adjustments to documentation and tests.

  • Implemented 'defer' keyword following TS 25755
  • Added -fdefer-ts flag and documentation updates
  • Modified code in c-common, c-cppbuiltin, and c-decl files
  • Enhanced tests for handling jumps into defer blocks
GCCdeferC Programming LanguageIR/PassReleaseBackend/Targetmedium

Introduce Jump Barriers for Statement Expressions in GCC

medium

The patch introduces jump barriers to prevent local jumps from crossing certain scope boundaries within statement expressions.

  • New structure `c_jump_barrier` introduced
  • Logic moved into a function for reuse with defer statements
  • Adjustments made to multiple functions in c-decl.cc

low

  • Support for handling expressions without associated declarations
  • Preparation for future use with defer statements

Add D_C2Y Disable Mask

low

A patch introduces a new disable mask `D_C2Y` for the C compiler and adjusts existing masks. This change involves file modifications in `c-family/c-common.h` and `c/c-parser.cc`. The adjustments are part of managing language features and extensions.

  • Introduces `D_C2Y` disable mask
  • Adjusts multiple existing masks for consistency
  • Modifies files: `c-family/c-common.h`, `c/c-parser.cc`

LoongArch: Atomic Operations Enhancements and Implementation of 16-byte Atomic Operations

medium

Series of patches for the LoongArch architecture focus on cleanup of atomic operations, introduction of a new option -m[no-]scq for enabling or disabling SCQ (Store/Compare Queue) instructions, and implementation of 16-byte atomic load/store operations.

  • Cleanup of existing atomic operation implementations
  • Introduction of -m[no-]scq option for managing SCQ instruction usage
  • Implementation of 16-byte atomic operations including load and store using LSX or SCQ instructions

LoongArch Compiler Optimizations and Refactoring

low

A series of commits on the GCC repository for LoongArch architecture focusing on optimization and minor refactoring changes.

  • Removed unneeded 'andi' instruction from atomic_test_and_set due to predefined shift amount limits
  • Changed constraints for atomic_load and atomic_store memory operands to reflect their non-modifying nature
  • Refactored code to remove atomic_optab in favor of amop, as they are equivalent
LoongArchGCCOptimizationRefactorlow

LoongArch Compiler Fix for Atomic Operations

medium

This change disables the expansion of atomic_fetch_sub_{hi, qi} to an LL-SC loop when the -mlam-bh flag is used. The adjustment ensures proper negation of the addend and use of amadd instruction.

  • - Disables atomic fetch subtract operation expansion for LoongArch under specific condition
  • - Improves handling with -mlam-bh flag, ensuring correct use of amadd instruction
LoongArchGCCCompiler FixAtomic Operationslow

LoongArch: Remove Unneeded Instruction After LL-SC Loops

low

This commit removes the unneeded "b 3f" instruction after load-linked/store-conditional (LL-SC) loops for LoongArch architecture. It modifies operand printing logic to include a conditional marker based on memory ordering and instruction set capabilities.

  • Removed unnecessary 'b 3f' instruction
  • Modified operand printing function to handle new case 'T'
  • Conditional printing of comment marker based on ISA features

LoongArch: Don't emit overly-restrictive barrier for LL-SC loops

medium

This commit modifies the LoongArch target in GCC to avoid emitting overly restrictive barriers for load-linked/store-conditional (LL-SC) loops. Specifically, it introduces a new UNSPEC_COMPARE_AND_SWAP_AMCAS operation and changes some existing operand constraints.

  • Introduces UNSPEC_COMPARE_AND_SWAP_AMCAS
  • Modifies operand constraints in LL-SC operations

LoongArch: Allow using bstrins for Address Masking in Atomic Operations

medium

The commit enables the use of 'bstrins' instruction to mask addresses in atomic_test_and_set operations, offering a future-proof solution by checking and forcing (const_int -4) into a register if it's not an and_operand.

  • Enable 'bstrins' for address masking
  • Future-proofing against LA32R limitations

low

x86: Place the TLS call before all FLAGS_REG setting BBs

medium

The patch discusses changes to how Thread Local Storage (TLS) calls are placed in basic blocks to avoid clobbering the flags register, which could affect conditional jumps.

  • Avoid placing a TLS call before a conditional jump that modifies flags.
  • Place TLS calls before all basic blocks setting register values dominating the current block.
  • GNU2 TLS only clobbers the flags register.
  • Patch addresses PR target/121572.
x86TLSGCCpatchlowBackend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAMe9rOqket6t_16dZKC5GqbvBTScEb0iVRHiy1KCK5eeZ-gFBQ@mail.gmail.com/

Avoid unnecessary constant load in amoswap

low

The PR resolves an issue where an atomic exchange loop on RISC-V was performing an unnecessary 'li target,0'. The operand's predicate and constraints were adjusted to allow (const_int 0) as input without tying it to the destination operand.

  • PR target/121213 avoids unnecessary constant load in amoswap
  • Operand's predicate changed to 'reg_or_0_operand'
  • Constraint changes to accommodate reg or const_int 0
  • No longer earlyclobbering the output operand
RISC-Vgccamoswapatomic exchangecode optimizationIR/PassBackend/TargetRegressionGCChigh

[PATCH 2/3] ira: tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

medium

This is a discussion thread about a patch related to improving instruction reordering (IRA) in the GCC compiler. The patch aims to ensure that output allocation numbers are tied for fused instruction pairs, which can affect how instructions are reordered during compilation.

  • Conceptually OK but with some concerns
  • Potential issues if PREV_INSN is used outside of the scheduler context
  • Use of prev_nonnote_nondebug_insn as a safer alternative due to potential problems with BB markers
gcccompilerIRApatchLinux KernelToolchainARM64RISC-VhighGCCOthersIR/Passx86_64Regression

IRA: Tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

medium

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/07a0baa7609a5a78d8b4a3c17897768fb2119605

  • Fused instruction pairs require that both components have the same hard register output for fusion in hardware.
  • Conditions (a)-(c) are encapsulated in the newly created predicate single_output_fused_pair_p().
  • During IRA, if conditions (a)-(c) hold, the two instructions' destination allocnos are tied together to allocate them to the same hard register.
GCCFusionInstruction PairRegister AllocationlowOthers

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/07a0baa7609a5a78d8b4a3c17897768fb2119605

RISC-V 编译器漏洞修复：扩展条件块匹配

high

GCC 编译器团队发布了一个补丁，解决了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析问题。此问题源于之前使用的简单正则表达式未能正确匹配包含多个代码块和闭合括号的条件块。

  • 修复了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析错误
  • 原始的简单正则表达式无法处理嵌套条件块及其闭合括号
  • 导致 'd' 和 'zcd' 被视为非条件依赖项，从而误导地添加到输出中
GCCRISC-V安全漏洞Othersx86_64lowBackend/Target

RISC-V 编译器漏洞修复：扩展条件块匹配

high

GCC 编译器团队发布了一个补丁，解决了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析问题。此问题源于之前使用的简单正则表达式未能正确匹配包含多个代码块和闭合括号的条件块。

  • 修复了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析错误
  • 原始的简单正则表达式无法处理嵌套条件块及其闭合括号
  • 导致 'd' 和 'zcd' 被视为非条件依赖项，从而误导地添加到输出中
GCCRISC-V安全漏洞Othersx86_64lowBackend/Target

[PATCH] x86: Place the TLS call before all FLAGS_REG setting BBs

medium

The patch modifies the placement of Thread Local Storage (TLS) calls in basic blocks to avoid clobbering flags registers, which can cause issues with conditional jumps. The change ensures that TLS calls are placed before any basic block that sets flags.

  • Avoid placing TLS call before a conditional jump in a basic block
  • Place TLS call before all register setting basic blocks dominating the current one
  • Fixes PR target/121572
x86TLSflags registerconditional jumpOtherslowBackend/Targetx86_64GCC

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250817004804.3710369-1-hjl.tools@gmail.com/

GCC 编译器中的Unnamed Unscoped Enums 链接更改实现

medium

This commit introduces changes to the GCC compiler regarding unnamed unscoped enums, specifically addressing linkage issues by adding a bitwise OR operator between TYPE_UNNAMED_P and enum_with_enumerator_for_linkage_p.

  • Implementing P2115R0 linkage changes for unnamed unscoped enums in GCC
  • Adding a bitwise OR condition to check if the type is either an unnamed or has an enumerator for linkage
  • Potential impact on existing code that relies on the current implementation of TYPE_UNNAMED_P and enum_with_enumerator_for_linkage_p

fortran: Set DECL_TLS_MODEL after processing a variable

low

Several commits and PRs have been made to modify the behavior of setting the DECL_TLS_MODEL attribute in Fortran compiler. The changes aim to ensure that set_decl_tls_model is called only after a variable has been fully processed, not during its processing.

  • Call set_decl_tls_model only after a variable has been fully processed
  • Changes made in gcc/fortran/trans-common.cc and gcc/fortran/trans-decl.cc
  • A new test case added for PR fortran/107421 in gfortran.dg/gomp/pr107421.f90
lowGCCOthersx86_64Backend/Target

c++: Fix ICE on mangling invalid compound requirement

high

This patch addresses a compiler issue causing an Internal Compiler Error (ICE) when handling invalid type-constraints in C++. The problem arises from the `write_requirement` function expecting a `TEMPLATE_TYPE_PARM`, which leads to failed assertions. To mitigate this, the trailing return type is set to NULL_TREE for invalid type-constraints, allowing some contexts to avoid redundant errors.

  • Fixes ICE caused by invalid type-constraint mangling
  • Prevents failed assertion in `write_requirement` function
  • Allows some invalid constraints to be satisfied in certain contexts
ICEGCClowOthersx86_64Backend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAD+gk=hBM+j_ffw3E+2Fpm3JvvWBLsSrOhViNjXXoqLdF5UbxA@mail.gmail.com/

tree-optimizationbehavior-changeshighGCCOthersIR/Passx86_64Backend/Target

Re: [PATCH] c++: Add testcases for the defarg part of P1766R1 [PR121552]

medium

This thread discusses adding test cases related to default arguments (defarg) in a C++ project. The discussion revolves around whether or not certain situations should be treated as errors, specifically regarding textual deduplication and ODR (Object Definition Rules). The main points of contention seem to be the interpretation of how different default argument definitions within different Translation Units (TUs) should be handled.

  • Discussion about whether certain situations involving default arguments in different TUs should result in errors or not
  • Concerns around textual deduplication and its impact on ODR rules
  • Need to determine the expected behavior of default argument definitions across different TU boundaries
C++default argumentsODR (Object Definition Rules)textual deduplicationGCCOtherslow

Re: [PATCH v2 1/3] AArch64: Support C/C++ operations on svbool_t

high

This patch series aims to support a subset of C/C++ operations such as bitwise, conditional, and others on the svbool_t type in AArch64 architecture. The changes include support for vector boolean types with new patterns added to the assembly file and modifications made in various parts of the compiler.

  • Support for vector boolean operations
  • New patterns defined for predicate modes
  • Modifications to existing functions such as `build_binary_op` and `cp_build_binary_op`
  • Changes to validation functions like `aarch64_valid_vector_boolean_op`, `aarch64_invalid_unary_op`, and `aarch64_invalid_binary_op`
AArch64Compiler EnhancementsBoolean OperationsARM64lowGCCOthersBackend/Target

medium

This is a discussion thread about a patch to add support for P2115R0 linkage changes for unnamed unscoped enums in the C++ compiler. The patch was reviewed and tested successfully on x86_64-pc-linux-gnu platform. The author proposes mangled names to distinguish these types from actual named types.

  • Patch implementing P2115R0 linkage changes for unnamed unscoped enums in the C++ compiler
  • Discussion about a proposal to use mangling to differentiate new enum type from existing ones
  • The patch is ready to be merged into trunk

PATCH: Improve locations for macros defined prior to PCH include

medium

A patch has been submitted to improve the location assignments of macros that are defined before including a Precompiled Header (PCH) in the libcpp codebase. The PR was originally about an Internal Compiler Error (ICE) in the linemap code that was resolved for GCC 14. This patch aims to handle macro definitions better, ensuring they remain distinct or identical from those in the PCH and are restored appropriately after loading.

  • Improvement of locations assignments for macros defined prior to PCH include
  • Handling of macros that might be defined before including a PCH
  • Restoration process similar to how command-line -D option is processed

ira: tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

medium

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKBaYYrbBSrKJnKZ@homesrv1/

  • Conceptual approval, with some concerns about the use of PREV_INSN due to potential issues like notes or line markers between fused instructions.
  • Proposed using prev_nonnote_nondebug_insn instead of PREV_INSN for better safety and avoiding compare-debug failures outside the scheduler context.
  • Intent is to simplify this patch and acknowledge it should be accepted independent of the main body of work, with a request to bootstrap and regtest it in isolation after adjusting PREV_INSN uses.
gccfused instructionsPREV_INSNprev_nonnote_nondebug_insnARM64RISC-VhighGCCOthersx86_64PerformanceRegression

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKBaYYrbBSrKJnKZ@homesrv1/

  • Diagnostics check multiple defargs in the same TU and visibility across modules

medium

  • Implementation of C++20 P1766R1
  • Adjustments for unnamed classes and static data members
  • Enhancements related to friend functions, unions, and enums

Fix default argument parsing in non-comma variadic methods

medium

The fix addresses the parsing of default arguments for non-comma variadic functions/methods, which are still valid in C++98 to C++23 but deprecated as of C++26. The change modifies the parser to correctly handle cases where a pack expansion ends with ... at depth 0.

  • Fixes default argument parsing for non-comma variadic methods
  • Addresses behavior in GCC versions supporting C++11 and later
  • Involves changes to the parser logic for handling ...
C++GCCParser FixVariadic MethodsDefault Argumentsx86_64highOthers

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/4bed19cf6170541ff757ee1b21d9fec9eb0c6541

GCC 编译器：#undef/#define of remaining cpp.predefined macros

high

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/cdd015c4ddbb1ae71eea1e44654cee5ca29a6c64

  • GCC 编译器引入了对 remaining cpp.predefined macros 的 #undef/#define 操作的警告机制。
  • 此变更涉及 c_cpp_builtins 函数以及在 c_stddef_cpp_builtins 和 cpp_define_warn 宏中的处理。
  • 此变更可能会影响使用这些宏的应用程序，特别是那些依赖于特定预定义宏的行为的应用程序。

  • 修改了源代码文件，减少了两行代码
CobolGCC 编译器技术更改GCCOtherslow

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/87f354ca75361faa2f40b826d632fbc49a082553

RISC-V: fix __builtin_round clobbering FP exceptions flags

medium

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/f5696e9b1113b0a8e464cabb8cc26c871b1d9289

  • __builtin_round() fails to save/restore FP exception flags around the FP compare insn which can potentially clobber the same.
  • The fflags restore bracketing is slightly different between GCC and glibc implementations.
  • gcc generates code where FSFLAGS is placed AFTER a branch, before the label 'L3'.
  • glibc implementation avoids FFLAGS clobber due to early NaN check, allowing it to be moved under the branch.
ABIbehavior destructionRISC-VlowGCCOthersBackend/Target

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/f5696e9b1113b0a8e464cabb8cc26c871b1d9289

GCC 编译器中针对计数引用的 .ACCESS_WITH_SIZE 调用条件更改

medium

在 GCC 编译器的一个提交中，代码对 `handle_counted_by_for_component_ref` 和 `default_function_array_read_conversion` 函数进行了修改。改动在于检查是否为读取操作时才调用 `.ACCESS_WITH_SIZE` 方法。

  • .ACCESS_WITH_SIZE 调用条件更改
  • 在计数引用（counted_reference）中仅在读取操作时调用
GCC 编译器性能回归安全性改进GCCOtherslowx86_64

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/1b34664c6255a7c1802e377be439f0d474dde0bb

Clang vs GCC ffp-contract Defaults on Benchmarking Impact

medium

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906

  • - Clang defaults to ffp-contract=on for C/C++ by default, disabling fused multiply-add across statements.
  • - GCC defaults to ffp-contract=fast unless a standard C dialect is explicitly set via e.g. std=c11.
  • - The difference in dynamically executed instructions impacts SPEC CPU 2017 benchmarks significantly for applications like namd and lbm.
ClangGCCBenchmarkingffp-contractSPEC CPU 2017GPUOthersPerformanceLLVMBackend/Targetmedium

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906

Using GOTPCREL relocations for personality and typeinfo eh_frame references?

medium

A discussion on using GETPCREL relocations to handle personality and typeinfo eh_frame references in Clang. The discussion addresses potential issues with the indirect encoding of pointers, specifically that they are emitted under the .data section, which could lead to deduplication across compile units and being writable.

  • Issues with indirect encoding for personality and typeinfo pointers
  • Potential issues with deduplication and writeability
  • Proposed solution: Use GOTPCREL relocations instead of creating stubs
CompilerClangRelocationsPersonality pointerTypeinfo referenceOthersGCCLLVMhighRISC-Vx86_64Backend/TargetToolchainARM64

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/using-gotpcrel-relocations-for-personality-and-typeinfo-eh-frame-references/87820

high

An operand of the nested yield op can be null and hasn't been verified yet when processing the enclosing operation, leading to a crash during verification.

A series of RISC-V LLVM sync-up calls held on various dates in the past year, including August 14th 2025, April 24th 2025, June 19th 2025, May 22nd 2025, and July 17th 2025. These calls were typically agenda and dial-in information shared in the RISC-V LLVM Discussion Forums.

  • RISC-V LLVM sync-up call August 14th 2025 - Placeholder for tomorrow (Thursday)'s call
RISC-V LLVM 开发开发者沟通技术协作

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/risc-v-llvm-sync-up-call-august-14th-2025/87891https://riscv-discuss. llvm.org/pipermail/riscv-discuss/attachments/20230830/a4a46c9d/attachment.txt

RFC: Support cheriot target triple as subarchitecture of riscv32

high

Following a broader RFC on upstreaming CHERI, there is discussion on adding support for the CHERIoT architecture in LLVM's target triple. CHERIoT is a full system architecture for a CHERI-based RISCV32E microcontroller, requiring more detailed discussion due to its unique characteristics and divergences from a RISCV32E + CHERI baseline.

  • Proposed addition of riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-unknown and riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-cheriotrtos triples to LLVM's target triple
  • Proposal includes parsing riscv32cheriot-... as an alias for riscv32cheriotv1-...
  • Detailed documentation of divergences from a RISCV32E + CHERI baseline, including instruction set extensions/restrictions, calling conventions changes, capability/permission formats alterations, source-level annotations exposure, relocation additions, and custom linkage model definition
RISC-VCHERITarget TripleRFCMicrocontroller ArchitecturehighLLVMOthersBackend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-support-cheriot-target-triple-as-subarchitecture-of-riscv32/87883

[RFC] Extending Memory Effects and Improving Loop Invariant Code Motion via a New MemInit Effect

medium

The proposal discusses extending memory effects to improve loop invariant code motion by introducing a new MemInit effect. It addresses potential misunderstandings around how the MemWrite effect is used and suggests changes for making certain operations movable under specific conditions.

  • Proposal aims to extend memory effects
  • Introduces new MemInit effect
  • Focuses on improving Loop Invariant Code Motion (LICM)
  • Suggests changes in handling MemWrite operations
LLVMRFCMemory EffectsLoop Invariant Code MotionOptimizationIR/Passlow

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-extending-memory-effects-and-improving-loop-invariant-code-motion-via-a-new-meminit-effect/87873

PSA: Automatic Location Inference in Python

medium

Automatic location inference feature has been added to LLVM's Python bindings, allowing IR source locations to be automatically inferred. It is initially disabled but can be enabled via the provided method.

  • Feature enables automatic inference of source locations in generated IR using Python bindings.
  • Can be enabled by setting _cext.globals.set_loc_tracebacks_enabled(True).
  • Supports inclusion and exclusion of filenames through specific registration functions.
LLVMPythonAutomatic Location InferenceIR GenerationIR/Passlow

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/psa-automatic-location-inference-in-python/87871

Thread safety analysis and std::weak_ptr

medium

I'm adding Thread Safety Annotations to my project which uses std::weak_ptr and types like it, which doesn't support PT_GUARDED_BY because it lacks operator* and operator->. I'm seeking recommendations on how to annotate those types that need protection for accessing the underlying type via std::weak_ptr::lock().

  • std::weak_ptr does not support PT_GUARDED_BY
  • Operator* and operator-> are missing from std::weak_ptr
  • Discussion about using alias analysis or custom attribute (lock_returned(*this)) on std::weak_ptr::lock() for thread safety
Thread Safetystd::weak_ptrPT_GUARDED_BYalias analysishighLLVMOthersx86_64Backend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/thread-safety-analysis-and-std-weak-ptr/87864

Note: Official binaries will be available later, provided by third-party binaries in a forum thread. File bugs and backports to the LLVM 21.x Release Milestone.

  • Download sources on GitHub
  • Third-party binaries will be posted in a forum thread
  • File bugs and backports to the LLVM 21.x Release Milestone

Error: Dialect 'xxx' Provides No Type Parsing Hook

medium

A user encountered an error when adding types to a dialect, indicating that there is no parser for the type despite including a necessary .inc file.

  • The error occurs due to missing parsing hooks for the added type in the dialect.
  • Check if tablegen-generated files include appropriate printer/parser methods for the type.
LLVMdialecttype parsingtablegenIR/Passlow

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/error-dialect-xxx-provides-no-type-parsing-hook/87825

LLVM Bundle Finalization for Security

high

Discussion on ensuring an instruction sequence remains intact and bypasses pre-RA transforms when using finalizeBundle in custom inserter.

  • finalizeBundle intended to make the sequence atomic to pipeline
  • MIFlag::NoMerge set to prevent merging or folding of bundled instructions
  • Concerns about preservation until RA completes
  • Post-RA expansion is recommended for pseudo instruction resolution
LLVMsecuritypre-RA transformsfinalizeBundlecustom inserterOthersBackend/Targetx86_64high

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/does-calling-finalizebundle-in-a-custom-inserter-keep-an-instruction-sequence-intact-and-bypass-pre-ra-transforms/87822

无法在 chroot 环境中构建简单的 hello.cpp

high

用户报告无法在使用 chroot 的环境下编译简单的 hello.cpp 源代码。他们提到 Clang 包 [SB2 sdk-build AuroraOS-5.1.5.105-base-aarch64.default] 未安装正确的库，导致构建失败。

  • 用户在 chroot 环境中无法编译简单的 hello.cpp
  • Clang 需要某些系统库以正常工作
  • 建议联系相关的 distro 问题而非 clang 开发者
CVEABI/行为破坏ARM64ToolchainlowLLVMOthersBackend/Target

Statically link libLLVM

medium

Hello all, I'm building a compiler using MLIR and CMake. My goal is to statically link all MLIR code into my library, but I’m running into issues. When I set -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=, CMake links MLIR statically into my library as expected. However, if I don’t set this path, CMake finds LLVM from the release or Homebrew, and my final library ends up depending on libLLVM.dylib instead.

  • Statically linking MLIR code into a library
  • Issue when CMake does not find the correct LLVM installation
  • Problem arises from -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH being unset
  • CMake finds LLVM from release/Homebrew, leading to dynamic linkage
CMakeMLIRStatic linkingLLVMDynamic linkageReleasemediumIR/Pass

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/statically-link-libllvm/87812

RFC: Supporting Multiple TOSA Specification Versions

high

The dialect has recently been updated to support version 1.0 of the TOSA specification, guaranteeing backwards-compatibility between minor versions. The RFC aims to enable validation and generation of multiple minor versions of the TOSA specification within the TOSA dialect.

  • Support for validating content against different versions of the TOSA specification
  • Ability to convert content to an earlier version of the TOSA specification where possible
SafetyCVEABI/Behavior DestructionCross-Platform DamagemediumReleaseLLVMIR/PassBackend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-supporting-multiple-tosa-specification-versions/87810

RFC: Extending UniformQuantizedType with interface-based support for new storage types in Quant dialect

high

Currently, UniformQuantizedType only supports built-in MLIR storage types such as Integer. There is a growing need to make the system extensible and maintainable as more types are added. The proposed interface-based approach aims to define a StorageTypeInterface that specifies required methods any storage type must implement to be used in UniformQuantizedType, encapsulating their type-specific logic for better scalability and maintainability.

  • Current implementation relies on dynamic checks (e.g., type switches or if-else chains) to determine the storage type and retrieve type-specific information for legality checks.
  • The proposed interface-based approach defines a StorageTypeInterface with required methods that any storage type must implement to be used in UniformQuantizedType, encapsulating their type-specific logic.
  • This change ensures MLIR can natively support new types like NF4 through a clean, extensible interface and improves scalability and maintainability of the system.
MLIRUniformQuantizedTypeStorageTypeInterfaceNF4Quant dialecthighBackend/TargetIR/PassLLVM

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-extending-uniformquantizedtype-with-interface-based-support-for-new-storage-types-in-quant-dialect/87803

Dialect Attributes in MLIR C-API

high

An issue was encountered where some attributes of a dialect (ODS dialect) operations cannot be read or written through the MLIR C-API, particularly with ODS dialect ops. The specific problem involves the cond attribute of the sv.ifdef.procedural op.

  • Unable to read/write certain attributes (cond in this case) of ODS dialect ops through MLIR C-API
  • C API limitations lead to issues like Melior not working as intended
  • Concrete example provided in a GitHub repository demonstrating the issue
  • The cond attribute returns true for existence but null type and false for being an #sv attribute
MLIR C-APIODS dialectsv.ifdef.procedural opDialect attribute issuesRustIR/PassLLVMBackend/Targethigh

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/dialect-attributes-in-mlir-c-api/87800https://github.com/jgreenbaum/mlir-c-api-attribute-issue

Swift

Crash when using Peer Macros with protocols

high

A peer macro for CurrentValueSubject works well in a class context but causes a runtime crash when used in a protocol context.

  • Peer macro works fine with classes but crashes with protocols.
  • Issue persists even after renaming the property to avoid $ suffix conflict.
SwiftCompilerPeer MacrosProtocolsRuntime Crashlow

https://forums.swift.org/t/crash-when-using-peer-macros-with-protocols/81690

Swift Compiler Diagnostics for Closure Typechecking

medium

The Swift compiler produces unhelpful diagnostics when attempting to typecheck large closures.

  • Compiler generates 'Type of expression is ambiguous without a type annotation'
  • Issue involves complex closure with guards, iterations, and nested structures
SwiftCompilerType CheckingDiagnosticslow

https://forums.swift.org/t/swift-compiler-diagnostics-when-typechecking-closures-are-not-good/81683

Observing Global State for MVVM Implementation

low

Swift Compiler Crash by Generics / Missing Conformance

high

A Swift compiler crash occurs due to missing conformance issues with generics, particularly related to the Hashable protocol.

  • The issue is triggered by an attempt to create a Set instance without ensuring all generic types conform to the Hashable protocol.
  • Minimal reproduction involves attempting to compile code where a struct is used in a Set but lacks Hashable conformance.
  • Fixes involve explicitly implementing Hashable for relevant structs and protocols.

Supporting Span in Swift Packages

medium

Information about supporting the new Span family of types being added to Swift's standard library, including backdeployment support restrictions and compiler requirements.

  • Span family includes Span, RawSpan, MutableSpan, MutableRawSpan, OutputSpan, and OutputRawSpan
  • UTF8Span does not have back-deployment support
  • Requires Swift 6.2 compiler for platforms without stable ABI (Linux, Windows, embedded targets)
  • On platforms with a stable ABI, APIs can run on macOS 10.14.4+, iOS 12.2+, watchOS 5.2+, tvOS 12.2+, and visionOS 1.0+
  • Annotations like conditional compilation and availability are needed to accommodate restrictions
SwiftSpanBackdeploymentAPI ChangesCompiler RequirementsReleasehighBackend/Target

Question about the Redirect directive

low

Discussion on the @redirected directive in DocC and its functionality regarding redirection.

  • The @redirected directive is used for metadata in JSON but does not create actual redirects within existing archives.
  • DocC treats redirect values as opaque data that are written to an optional metadata file if additional flags are passed.
  • External redirection capabilities depend on the hosting provider's setup and not DocC itself.

medium

This update from Wasmtime introduces the ability to use Winch, a baseline WebAssembly compiler, with AArch64 architecture. It also supports Core Wasm proposals and additional features like the Component Model and Custom Page Sizes.

  • Additional support for the Component Model and Custom Page Sizes included
